Description: Onyx cameo portrait bust of a Roman woman wearing a stola. The thick folds of a conventional tunic are clearly visible below. The eyes are rounded and deep set, the nose wide and the lips thick. The hair is arranged in curls rising in four tiers to the crown of the head. The woman's dress indicates that she is of high social rank.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Alexandria (Egypt), tomb (said to be from) (near)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces
Acquisition notes: Obtained in Alexandria about 1890 by the vendor's grandfather.
